intro: Crepidopteris gracillima, commonly known as the slender chain fern, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the family Davalliaceae and is characterized by its delicate, feathery fronds that grow in a cascading manner. The plant features a slender, creeping rhizome that helps it spread along the forest floor. Its leaves are typically light green and have a soft, velvety texture. Crepidopteris gracillima thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests.
